intro: Aniseia velloziana var. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered aniseia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its visual appeal in gardens.
